person.name: Bruce D. Porter
person.description: Elder Bruce D. Porter was called as a General Authority of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in April 1995. In 2003 he was called to serve as a member of the First Quorum of the Seventy. Prior to his full-time Church service, Elder Porter was serving as a professor of political science at Brigham Young University. He served earlier as executive director of the U.S. Board for International Broadcasting and as a research fellow at Harvard University. He has also served as an analyst for the Northrop Corporation and as a staff member of the U.S. Senate Armed Services Committee.
